FuncDef:
The probe-failtimes command configures a threshold for the number of consecutive probe failures in an NQA TCP test instance. Once this threshold is reached, a trap is sent to the NMS.
The undo probe-failtimes command restores the default configuration. The probe-failtimes command configures a threshold for the number of consecutive probe failures in an NQA TCP test instance. Once this threshold is reached, a trap is sent to the NMS. The undo probe-failtimes command restores the default configuration. By default, a trap is sent for each probe failure.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the threshold for the number of consecutive probe failures in an NQA test instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 15.

ExtraInfo:
An NQA test checks whether response packets are received in a probe.  If no response to a probe packet is received, the probe fails. When the number of consecutive probe failures in an NQA test instance reaches the specified threshold, a trap is sent to the NMS.
This command is used to set the number of consecutive probe failures, that is, the number of consecutive packet sending failures. The test-failtimes command is used to set the number of consecutive test failures. Multiple packets may be sent in a test, that is, a test may contain multiple probes.
